sub_topic: Calculation of magnetic field due to a current-carrying plane
message_1: A plane sheet of dimensions 20 cm by 30 cm carries a current of 2 A. What is the magnitude and direction of the magnetic field at a point 5 cm above the center of the sheet? Assume that the sheet lies in the xy-plane with one of its corners at the origin, and the current flows in the positive x-direction.
message_2:
To find the magnetic field at a point above the center of the sheet, we can use the Biot-Savart law. However, since the sheet is infinitely thin and has a uniform current density, we can simplify the problem by considering the sheet as a collection of parallel current-carrying wires.

The current density (J) can be calculated as follows:

J = Total current / Area of the sheet
J = 2 A / (20 cm × 30 cm) = 2 A / 600 cm² = 1/300 A/cm²

Now, let's consider a small strip of width dx at a distance x from the y-axis. The current in this strip is given by:

dI = J × width × length
dI = (1/300 A/cm²) × dx × 30 cm = (1/10) dx A

The magnetic field dB due to this strip at a point P (5 cm above the center of the sheet) can be calculated using the Biot-Savart law:

dB = (μ₀ / 4π) × (dI × dl) / r²

Here, μ₀ is the permeability of free space (4π × 10⁻⁷ Tm/A), dl is the length of the strip (30 cm), and r is the distance from the strip to point P.

Since the strip is parallel to the y-axis, the distance r can be calculated as:

r = √((x - 10 cm)² + (5 cm)²)

Now, we can find the magnetic field dB due to the strip at point P:

dB = (μ₀ / 4π) × (dI × dl) / r²
dB = (10⁻⁷ Tm/A) × ((1/10) dx A × 30 cm) / (√((x - 10 cm)² + (5 cm)²))²

The total magnetic field B at point P can be found by integrating dB over the width of the sheet (from 0 to 20 cm):

B = ∫(dB) from 0 to 20 cm
B = ∫((10⁻⁷ Tm/A) × ((1/10) dx A × 30 cm) / ((x - 10 cm)² + (5 cm)²)) from 0 to 20 cm

After integrating, we get:

B = (6 × 10⁻⁷ T) × (arctan(2) - arctan(-1)) ≈ 1.97 × 10⁻⁶ T

The direction of the magnetic field can be found using the right-hand rule. Since the current flows in the positive x-direction, the magnetic field at point P will be in the positive z-direction.

So, the magnitude of the magnetic field at point P is approximately 1.97 × 10⁻⁶ T, and its direction is in the positive z-direction.
